p: The medicinal plant sector in Morocco has a rich and varied flora with very marked endemism [ 10]. The species of Thymus L. (Lamiaceae) are perennial, aromatic herbs, and widely used in the Mediterranean Basin [ 11]. Thymus leptobotrys Murb. is an endemic species of southern Morocco traditionally used in the treatment of bronchitis, indigestion, whooping cough, and rheumatism [ 12] and has antifungal, antimicrobial, analgesic, insecticidal, antioxidant, and antiviral properties [ 13â€“ 16].
